sentences.en: As a defensive matter that is excusable, the duress has its own rationality.
sentences.cn: 被迫行为作为一种可宽恕的辩护事由, 有其科学合理之处.

sentences.en: Considering her difficult childhood her behaviour is excusable.
sentences.cn: 考虑到她艰难的孩童时期,她的行为是能够原谅的.

sentences.en: Doing it once was just about excusable — doing it twice was certainly not.
sentences.cn: 这种事干一次也许还可以原谅，干两次就绝对不能了。

sentences.en: His fault is excusable, considering his age.
sentences.cn: 就年龄而言,他的过错是可原谅的.

sentences.en: However, Corporation shall use all reasonable efforts to minimize the effects of any Excusable Delay hereunder.
sentences.cn: 但公司应尽一切努力减少可谅解延迟所造成的后果.

sentences.en: It is to be regarded as excusable in the light of circumstances.
sentences.cn: 考虑到具体情况,这将被看作是可以原谅的.

sentences.en: Late arrival for a job interview is never excusable.
Mice, can be in the kitchen and chests, belly - worship, people thinks this is excusable however.
sentences.cn: 老鼠呢, 可以在厨房里翻箱倒柜,大吃大喝, 人们却认为这是情有可原.

sentences.en: Seeing that he is so young, that is excusable.
sentences.cn: 鉴于他如此年轻, 这是可以原谅的.

words.tran_cn: 作为借口；请求宽恕；表示宽恕

trans.tran_cn: 可原谅的，可容许的，言之有理的，可免除的
trans.tran_en: behaviour that is excusable can be forgiven
